Vulcan is recruiting!

We are focused on the future and are actively seeking new members. If you live near San Mateo and are interested in FTC, consider applying!

Click here to apply

Vulcan Robotics

We are an award-winning independent robotics team of five high school students from San Mateo, CA. This is our first year participating in the FIRST Tech Challenge (FTC), an annual competition where students from around the world build robots to complete game challenges. For more information on FIRST and the FTC competition, visit the official FIRST website.

2015 Off-Season

Despite that the fact that our competition season is over, we are continuing to work on our team. We plan to build a new drive train, work on outreach, and train the new team members.

More Info

2014/2015 Season

The 2014/2015 season was our team's rookie year. The game, Cascade Effect, was centered around scoring balls in rolling goals and having goals pushed around the field.

More Info

Outreach

Throughout the year, we work on communicating and reaching out to our community to spread the word about FIRST and robotics. This includes outreach online, at competitions, and at local libraries and schools.

More Info

What Is FIRST?

"FIRST's mission is to inspire young people to be science and technology leaders, by engaging them in exciting mentor-based programs that build science, engineering and technology skills, that inspire innovation, and that foster well-rounded life capabilities including self-confidence, communication, and leadership" (from FIRST website).

More Info

What is FIRST Tech Challenge (FTC)?

FTC is designed for students in grades 7-12 to compete head to head, using a sports model. Teams are responsible for designing, building, and programming their robots to compete in an alliance format against other teams. The robot kit is reusable from year-to-year and is programmed using a variety of languages. Teams, including coaches, mentors and volunteers, are required to develop strategy and build robots based on sound engineering principles. Awards are given for the competition as well as for community outreach, design, and other real-world accomplishments (from FIRST website).

More Info

Summer Design Workshops

This summer, we will be hosting 4 design workshops with different themes at the San Mateo Main Library.
When: 4 Saturdays - June 13 & 20, July 11 & 18, from 2-4 pm
Who: All students in grades 5-8
Where: San Mateo Main Library, Oak Room
